importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the Blue Jays' decisive victory in the ALCS occurred, marking a pivotal moment in the postseason.

Six days prior to the game, the Mariners scored five runs in four innings against Yesavage in Game 2, highlighting a turning point in the series that set the stage for his improved performance in Game 7.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The six-day span between the Mariners' offensive outburst and their decisive loss underscores a critical shift in momentum, showcasing Yesavage’s composure and the Blue Jays’ resilience.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the postseason, a pivotal moment that extends Toronto’s lead to 5-0 and forces a Game 7 in the ALCS.
The Seattle Mariners’ season-high three errors, including two in the second inning, significantly contributed to Toronto’s early lead and series momentum.
Randy Yesavage pitches effectively, throwing a season-high 31 splitters, allowing only six hits and three walks, and recording seven strikeouts despite facing high pressure.
The Blue Jays’ victory forces a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking their second such game in franchise history and their first since 1985.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
The Mariners’ first Game 7 in franchise history signals a historic moment for the team, reflecting a dramatic reversal in playoff trajectory.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the postseason, propelling the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners and forcing a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Blue Jays' win, bolstered by three critical errors from the Mariners—including fielding mishaps by Julio Rodríguez and Eugenio Suárez—and strong pitching from Randy Yesavage, marks their first Game 7 since 1985 and their second in franchise history. The Mariners, making history by playing their first Game 7, lose their chance to advance, with the winner of the series set to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
